description: From French chitine, from Latin chitōn (“mollusk”), from Ancient Greek χιτών (khitṓn). See also chiton.

entries.meaning: (biochemistry) A complex polysaccharide, a polymer of N-acetylglucosamine, found in the exoskeletons of arthropods and in the cell walls of fungi; thought to be responsible for some forms of asthma in humans.
examples: Chitin usually occurs throughout Invertebrates in the form of an investment to the outermost cellular layer or ectoderm.
